faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know to get started.

q1.question: How does MonProjetMaison help stay within budget?
q1.answer: Our budget tracking tool lets you categorize each expense, compare with initial estimates, and receive alerts for overruns. AI analysis can also identify at-risk items.

q2.question: Can I manage multiple projects?
q2.answer: Current plans include 1 active project. If you need to manage multiple projects simultaneously, contact us for a customized solution.

q3.question: Is my data secure?
q3.answer: Yes, all your data is encrypted and stored securely. We never share your information with third parties.

q4.question: How do quotes and estimates work?
q4.answer: You can upload your quotes as PDFs or enter them manually. Our AI can analyze documents to extract key information and help you compare offers.

q5.question: Can I cancel or change plans?
q5.answer: You can change plans or cancel anytime. Changes take effect at the next billing period.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.subtitle: At Monprojetmaison.ca, we take the protection of your personal information seriously.
privacy.contactDescription: For any questions regarding this privacy policy or to exercise your personal information rights, please contact us:
privacy.legalNote: Note: This privacy policy complies with Quebec's Act Respecting the Protection of Personal Information in the Private Sector and Canada's Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA).

1.title: Information collection
1.intro: Monprojetmaison.ca collects personal information when you use our platform to plan your residential construction or renovation project. The information we collect may include:
items: Your name, email address, and phone number
Details of your construction or renovation project
Your geographic location in Quebec
Your project preferences and specifications
Information about how you use our platform

2.title: Use of information
2.intro: We use your personal information for the following purposes:
items: Providing and improving our project planning services
Connecting you with qualified contractors and professionals
Personalizing your experience on our platform
Sending you relevant communications about your project
Complying with our legal and regulatory obligations
Analyzing and optimizing platform usage

3.title: Information sharing
3.intro: Monprojetmaison.ca never sells your personal information. We may share your information in the following circumstances:
items: With qualified contractors and professionals to carry out your project
With service providers who help us operate our platform
When required by law or to protect our legal rights
With your explicit consent for specific purposes
3.footer: All our partners are required to respect the confidentiality of your information and comply with applicable data protection laws.

4.title: Information protection
4.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, modification, disclosure, or destruction. These measures include:
items: Encryption of sensitive data in transit and at rest
Strict access controls and secure authentication
Continuous monitoring of our security systems
Regular staff training on data protection
Periodic security audits

5.title: International data transfers
5.intro: Some of our service providers and technology partners may be located outside Canada, particularly in the United States. When your personal information is transferred internationally, we ensure that:
items: Appropriate contractual protection measures are in place
Providers meet equivalent security standards
Transfers are limited to what is strictly necessary
Your rights remain protected under Canadian law
5.footer: By using our platform, you consent to these transfers under the conditions described above.

6.title: Your rights
6.intro: In accordance with Quebec and Canadian personal information protection laws, you have the following rights:
items: Right of access: You may request a copy of the personal information we hold about you
Right of rectification: You may request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
Right of deletion: You may request deletion of your personal information in certain circumstances
Right of objection: You may object to certain uses of your information
Right to withdraw consent: You may withdraw your consent at any time
6.footer: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided below.

7.title: Cookies and similar technologies
7.intro: Our platform uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your user experience, analyze site usage, and personalize content. You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings.
7.footer: The cookies we use include essential cookies necessary for site operation, analytics cookies to understand how you use our platform, and performance cookies to optimize your experience.

8.title: Data retention
8.intro: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to provide our services and meet our legal obligations. Retention periods vary by data type:
items: Account data: For the duration of your active account plus 2 years after closure
Project data: For the duration of the project plus 7 years for reference and tax compliance
Communications: 3 years after the last interaction
Analytics data: In aggregated and anonymized form indefinitely
Legal documents: In accordance with applicable legal requirements (generally 7 years)
8.footer: After these periods, we securely delete or anonymize your information, unless we are legally required to retain it longer.

9.title: Third-party services and integrations
9.intro: Our platform may integrate or use third-party services to enhance your experience:
items: Payment processors: To securely process transactions (e.g., Stripe, PayPal)
Analytics tools: To understand platform usage (e.g., Google Analytics)
Mapping services: To locate projects and contractors
Social networks: Share buttons that may transmit information to social platforms
9.footer: These third-party services have their own privacy policies. We encourage you to review them. Monprojetmaison.ca is not responsible for the privacy practices of these third parties.

10.title: Use of artificial intelligence
10.intro: Monprojetmaison.ca may use artificial intelligence technologies to improve our services, including:
items: Recommending qualified contractors based on your project
Estimating project costs and timelines
Personalizing your platform experience
Detecting and preventing fraudulent activities
10.footer: Data used to train our AI models is aggregated and anonymized. We never share your identifiable personal information with external AI systems without your explicit consent.

11.title: Security incident management
11.intro: In the event of a data breach likely to pose a serious risk of harm, we commit to:
items: Notifying you as soon as possible, in accordance with legal requirements
Informing the Privacy Commissioner of Canada if required
Providing information about the nature of the incident and corrective measures
Taking immediate action to limit damage and prevent future incidents
Advising you on actions you can take to protect your information
11.footer: We maintain an incident response plan that is regularly tested and updated.

12.title: Protection of minors
12.intro: Our services are not intended for persons under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from minors.
12.footer: If we discover that a minor has provided us with personal information, we will immediately delete this information from our systems. If you believe a minor has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately.

13.title: "Do Not Track" (DNT) signal
13.intro: Some browsers include a "Do Not Track" (DNT) feature that sends a signal to websites indicating that you do not wish to be tracked.
13.footer: Currently, there is no recognized industry standard for responding to DNT signals. Therefore, we do not automatically respond to DNT signals. However, you can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings and our consent banner.

14.title: Policy modifications
14.intro: We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time. Any modifications will be posted on this page with a revised update date. We encourage you to regularly review this policy to stay informed about how we protect your information.
14.footer: If we make significant changes, we will notify you by email or through a notification on our platform.

cookies.title: Cookie
cookies.subtitle: This policy explains how Monprojetmaison.ca uses cookies and similar technologies.
cookies.contactDescription: If you have any questions regarding our use of cookies, please contact us:

1.title: What is a cookie?
1.content: A cookie is a small text file stored on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit a website. Cookies allow the site to remember your actions and preferences (such as language, font size, and other display preferences) for a period of time, so you don't have to re-enter them every time you return to the site or navigate from one page to another.

2.title: Types of cookies used
2.intro: We use different categories of cookies on Monprojetmaison.ca:

essential.name: Essential cookies
essential.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function. They enable navigation, access to secure areas, and the use of basic features. Without these cookies, the site cannot function properly.

analytics.name: Analytics cookies
analytics.description: These cookies collect anonymous information about how visitors use our site. They help us improve our platform by understanding which pages are most visited and how users navigate.
examples: Bounce rate and time spent on site

marketing.name: Marketing cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across different websites. Their purpose is to display relevant and personalized advertisements, making them more useful for publishers and third-party advertisers.

functional.name: Functional cookies
functional.description: These cookies enhance website functionality and personalize your experience. They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages.

3.title: Retention period
3.intro: The cookies we use have different retention periods:
items: Session cookies: Automatically deleted when you close your browser
Persistent cookies: Retained for a set period (generally 1 month to 2 years depending on their function)
Third-party cookies: Their duration depends on the policies of the third parties concerned

4.title: Managing your preferences
4.intro: You have full control over cookies. You can:
items: Accept or refuse non-essential cookies via our consent banner
Modify your preferences at any time by clicking the button below
Configure your browser to block or delete cookies
Use browser extensions to manage cookies

5.title: Browser configuration
5.intro: You can also manage cookies directly from your browser. Here are links to instructions for the main browsers:

6.title: Third-party cookies
6.content: Our site may contain cookies placed by third parties (partners, advertisers, social networks). These third parties have their own privacy and cookie policies. We have no control over these cookies and encourage you to consult these third parties' policies for more information.

7.title: Legal compliance
7.intro: Our use of cookies complies with the following regulations:
items: Canada's Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
Quebec's Act Respecting the Protection of Personal Information in the Private Sector (Law 25)
European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
European Union's ePrivacy Directive

8.title: Updates
8.content: We may update this cookie policy from time to time to reflect changes in our use of cookies or legal requirements. We encourage you to regularly check this page. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of this page.

planification.title: Project Planning
planification.description: Define your needs, budget and goals before starting.

besoins.title: Define your needs
besoins.description: List the number of bedrooms, bathrooms, storage spaces and desired features.
tips: Think about your future needs (growing family, working from home)
Visit model homes for inspiration

budget-initial.title: Establish preliminary budget
budget-initial.description: Calculate your financial capacity including land, construction and contingencies.
tips: Plan for 10-15% of the budget for contingencies
Include connection fees (electricity, water, sewer)

terrain.title: Land search and purchase
terrain.description: Find land that meets your criteria and verify zoning.
tips: Check municipal zoning regulations
Have a soil study done before purchase

preapprobation-planification.title: Mortgage pre-approval
preapprobation-planification.description: Get pre-approval from your financial institution to know your maximum borrowing capacity.
tips: Compare offers from several banks and brokers
A pre-approval is generally valid for 90 to 120 days
Prepare your proof of income and bank statements

plans-permis.title: Plans and Permits
plans-permis.description: Have your plans prepared and obtain all necessary permits.

plans-architecture.title: Architectural plans
plans-architecture.description: Hire an architect or technologist to draw your plans.
tips: Consider purchasing pre-designed plans to speed up the process and reduce costs ‚Äî several Quebec suppliers offer adaptable models
Ensure plans comply with the Building Code
Include structural and mechanical plans
As soon as you get your plans, start soliciting quotes to speed up project preparation

test-sol.title: Soil test (geotechnical study)
test-sol.description: Have a geotechnical study done to determine soil bearing capacity and required foundation type.
tips: Required to obtain permit in many municipalities
Determines the appropriate foundation type
Identifies high water table risks

services-publics.title: Services validation (water, sewer)
services-publics.description: Check availability of municipal services (water, sewer) or plan private installations (well, septic tank, drain field).
tips: Contact the municipality to find out what services are available
If off-grid: plan soil study for septic installation
The drain field requires adequate land area
An artesian well may require multiple drillings

permis-construction.title: Building permit application
permis-construction.description: Submit your application to the municipality with all required documents.
tips: Processing time varies by municipality (2-8 weeks)
Some municipalities require a professional's commitment

soumissions.title: Quotes
soumissions.description: Obtain and compare quotes from different trades.

obtenir-soumissions.title: Obtain quotes
obtenir-soumissions.description: Request detailed quotes from different trades.
tips: Get at least 3 quotes per specialty
Don't choose solely based on the lowest price ‚Äî use AI analysis to help you compare
Check contractor references
Request proof of liability insurance
Verify RBQ licenses of contractors (https://www.rbq.gouv.qc.ca/en/be/citizen/check-contractors-licence/)
Compare warranties and proposed timelines

assurance-chantier.title: Construction insurance
assurance-chantier.description: Take out construction insurance to protect your project.
tips: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Make sure coverage starts BEFORE the first shovel hits the ground
Construction insurance covers damage during construction
Verify coverage includes theft, vandalism and weather damage
Request proof of liability insurance from all your contractors
In case of injury on site, the owner-builder is held responsible ‚Äî liability insurance is essential
Compare several brokers to get the best rate

financement.title: Financing
financement.description: Obtain your financing and prepare your financial plan.

pret-construction.title: Construction loan
pret-construction.description: Negotiate your construction loan with progressive disbursements.
tips: Funds are released in stages based on progress
Plan for personal funds for initial expenses

excavation.title: Excavation
excavation.description: Site preparation and digging for foundations.

implantation.title: House staking
implantation.description: The surveyor positions the house on the lot according to plans.
tips: Respect required setbacks
Have it verified before excavation

deboisement.title: Land clearing
deboisement.description: Tree felling and clearing of the construction zone.
tips: Check municipal regulations regarding tree cutting
Some municipalities require a cutting permit
Plan for transport or chipping of branches and stumps

excavation-creusage.title: Digging and excavation
excavation-creusage.description: Digging for basement and site preparation.
tips: Plan for storage of excavated soil or budget for hauling
Protect excavation from rain and have a pump ready for water removal

coulage-fondation.title: Foundation pouring
coulage-fondation.description: Installation of forms and concrete pouring for footings and walls.
tips: Concrete curing: wait at least 21 days before loading
Waterproof foundation walls with tar membrane or Delta-MS membrane for optimal waterproofing

drain-remblai.title: Drain and backfill
drain-remblai.description: Installation of French drain and backfilling around foundations.
tips: Use perforated PVC drain with cleanouts for durable and easy maintenance drainage

structure.title: Structure and Framing
structure.description: Erection of the wood or steel structure of the house.

plancher.title: Ground floor
tips: Protect subfloor from weather during construction
Check level before continuing
Use open-web trusses to facilitate electrical and plumbing runs

murs.title: Wall erection
murs.description: Construction and raising of exterior and load-bearing interior walls.
tips: Respect openings shown on plans
Install headers above openings

etage.title: Upper floor structure
etage.description: If applicable, construction of floor and walls of upper level.
tips: Use open-web trusses to facilitate electrical and plumbing runs

fermes-toit.title: Roof truss installation
fermes-toit.description: Installation of prefabricated trusses or traditional framing construction.

pontage.title: Roof sheathing
pontage.description: Installation of plywood on roof trusses to close the structure.
tips: Protect sheathing from weather quickly
Check panel alignment

etancheite.title: Waterproofing
etancheite.description: Installation of waterproofing membranes and infiltration protection.
tips: Ensure all joints are properly sealed
Check waterproofing around openings (windows, doors)

toiture.title: Roofing
toiture.description: Installation of membrane and roofing material.

membrane.title: Membrane and shingles
membrane.description: Installation of waterproof membrane and asphalt shingles or other covering.
tips: Install flashing around chimneys and vents
Self-adhesive membrane is required in risk areas
Apply self-adhesive membrane in the first 4 feet of roof edges for better protection
Ensure good ventilation to release heat. Poor ventilation can prematurely deteriorate the covering
Have fascia starter strips installed under the self-adhesive membrane for proper water runoff in case of leak

fenetres-portes.title: Windows and Exterior Doors
fenetres-portes.description: Installation of windows and doors to close the envelope.

fenetres.title: Window installation
fenetres.description: Window installation with insulation and perimeter sealing.
tips: Use low-expansion foam insulation
Install window flashing correctly

portes-ext.title: Exterior doors
portes-ext.description: Installation of entry, garage and patio doors.

isolation.title: Insulation and Vapor Barrier
isolation.description: Installation of thermal insulation and vapor barrier.

isolation-murs.title: Wall insulation
isolation-murs.description: Installation of insulation in exterior walls (batt, cellulose or foam).
tips: R-24 minimum for walls in Quebec
Avoid thermal bridges

isolation-toit.title: Roof/attic insulation
isolation-toit.description: Insulation of top floor ceiling or cathedral ceiling.
tips: R-41 minimum for roofs in Quebec
Maintain adequate attic ventilation, use a deflector at the bottom of sheathing to maximize ventilation

insonorisation.title: Soundproofing
insonorisation.description: Installation of acoustic insulation between rooms and floors.
tips: Good soundproofing of bedrooms and bathrooms improves comfort and privacy by reducing airborne noise through acoustic insulation and proper installation techniques
Prioritize walls between bedrooms and bathrooms
Use acoustic wool or specialized membranes
Floor soundproofing significantly reduces impact noise

pare-vapeur.title: Vapor barrier
pare-vapeur.description: Installation of 6 mil polyethylene on the warm side of insulation.
tips: Seal all joints and penetrations
Blower door test will verify airtightness
Ensure there are no perforations in the vapor barrier, repair with vapor barrier tape
